meanings.definition: A short, sharp sound made by a horn or whistle.
meanings.sent1: The loud toot of the train horn startled the children.
meanings.sent2: I heard a toot coming from the car behind me.
meanings.sent3: The toot of the horn made everyone jump in surprise.
meanings.sent4: The toot of the whistle signaled the start of the race.
meanings.sent5: The toot echoed through the valley, signaling the arrival of the train.

meanings.definition: A blast of wind or air.
meanings.sent1: The sudden toot of wind blew my hat off.
meanings.sent2: A refreshing toot of air greeted us as we opened the window.
meanings.sent3: The toot of wind messed up my hair, making me look silly.
meanings.sent4: The toot of air carried the scent of flowers from the garden.
meanings.sent5: The toot of wind brought relief on a hot summer day.

meanings.definition: To make a short, sharp sound.
meanings.sent1: I saw the clown toot his horn to make the children laugh.
meanings.sent2: The car behind me started to toot impatiently at the slow driver.
meanings.sent3: The goose tooted loudly, surprising everyone in the park.
meanings.sent4: The trumpet tooted a cheerful tune at the parade.
meanings.sent5: The bicycle bell tooted as the kids rode around the neighborhood.

meanings.sent1: Grandpa let out a loud toot at the dinner table.
meanings.sent2: The toot in the elevator made everyone giggle.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected toot during the meeting caused some embarrassment.
meanings.sent4: The little boy blamed the toot on the dog, but everyone knew the truth.
meanings.sent5: A toot escaped from the comedian, causing laughter in the audience.
